text: After the death of Moses the servant of the Lord, the Lord spoke to Joshua son of Nun, Moses’s assistant, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “My servant Moses is dead. Now proceed to cross the Jordan, you and all this people, into the land that I am giving to them, to the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every place that the sole of your foot will tread upon I have given to you, as I promised to Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the wilderness and the Lebanon as far as the great river, the River Euphrates, all the land of the Hittites, to the Great Sea in the west shall be your territory.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one shall be able to stand against you all the days of your life. As I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will not fail you or forsake you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong and courageous, for you shall lead this people to possess the land that I swore to their ancestors to give them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only be strong and very courageous, being careful to act in accordance with all the law that my servant Moses commanded you; do not turn from it to the right hand or to the left, so that you may be successful wherever you go.
speaker: Narrator

text: This book of the law shall not depart out of your mouth; you shall meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to act in accordance with all that is written in it. For then you shall make your way prosperous, and then you shall be successful.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hereby command you: Be strong and courageous; do not be frightened or dismayed, for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Pass through the camp and command the people, ‘Prepare your provisions, for in three days you are to cross over this Jordan, to go in to take possession of the land that the Lord your God gives you to possess.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh Joshua said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Remember the word that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you, saying, ‘The Lord your God is providing you a place of rest and will give you this land.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Your wives, your little ones, and your livestock shall remain in the land that Moses gave you beyond the Jordan. But all the warriors among you shall cross over armed before your kindred and shall help them,
speaker: Narrator

text: until the Lord gives rest to your kindred as well as to you, and they also take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving them. Then you shall return to your own land and take possession of it, the land that Moses the servant of the Lord gave you beyond the Jordan to the east.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered Joshua, “All that you have commanded us we will do, and wherever you send us we will go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as we obeyed Moses in all things, so we will obey you. Only may the Lord your God be with you, as he was with Moses!
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever rebels against your orders and disobeys your words, whatever you command, shall be put to death. Only be strong and courageous.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua son of Nun sent two men secretly from Shittim as spies, saying, “Go, view the land, especially Jericho.” So they went and entered the house of a prostitute whose name was Rahab and spent the night there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Jericho was told, “Some Israelites have come here tonight to search out the land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Jericho sent orders to Rahab, “Bring out the men who have come to you, who entered your house, for they have come to search out the whole land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the woman took the two men and hid them. Then she said, “True, the men came to me, but I did not know where they came from.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it was time to close the gate at dark, the men went out. Where the men went I do not know. Pursue them quickly, for you can overtake them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She had, however, brought them up to the roof and hidden them with the stalks of flax that she had laid out on the roof.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the men pursued them on the way to the Jordan as far as the fords. As soon as the pursuers had gone out, the gate was shut.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before they went to sleep, she came up to them on the roof
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to the men, “I know that the Lord has given you the land and that dread of you has fallen on us and that all the inhabitants of the land melt in fear before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we have heard how the Lord dried up the water of the Red Sea before you when you came out of Egypt and what you did to the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon and Og, whom you utterly destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as we heard it, our hearts melted, and there was no courage left in any of us because of you. The Lord your God is indeed God in heaven above and on earth below.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then, since I have dealt kindly with you, swear to me by the Lord that you in turn will deal kindly with my family. Give me a sign of good faith
speaker: Narrator

text: that you will spare my father and mother, my brothers and sisters, and all who belong to them and deliver our lives from death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The men said to her, “Our life for yours! If you do not tell this business of ours, then we will deal kindly and faithfully with you when the Lord gives us the land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she let them down by a rope through the window, for her house was on the outer side of the city wall and she resided within the wall itself.
speaker: Narrator

text: She said to them, “Go toward the hill country, so that the pursuers may not come upon you. Hide yourselves there three days, until the pursuers have returned; then afterward you may go your way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The men said to her, “We will be released from this oath that you have made us swear to you
speaker: Narrator

text: if we invade the land and you do not tie this crimson cord in the window through which you let us down and you do not gather into your house your father and mother, your brothers, and all your family.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any of you go out of the doors of your house into the street, they shall be responsible for their own death, and we shall be innocent, but if a hand is laid upon any who are with you in the house, we shall bear the responsibility for their death.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you tell this business of ours, then we shall be released from this oath that you made us swear to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “According to your words, so be it.” She sent them away, and they departed. Then she tied the crimson cord in the window.
speaker: Narrator

text: They departed and went into the hill country and stayed there three days, until the pursuers returned. The pursuers had searched all along the way and found nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the two men came down again from the hill country. They crossed over, came to Joshua son of Nun, and told him all that had happened to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Joshua, “Truly the Lord has given all the land into our hands; moreover, all the inhabitants of the land melt in fear before us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Early in the morning Joshua rose and set out from Shittim with all the Israelites, and they came to the Jordan. They camped there before crossing over.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the end of three days, the officers went through the camp
speaker: Narrator

text: and commanded the people, “When you see the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God being carried by the Levitical priests, then you shall set out from your place. Follow it,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may know the way you should go, for you have not passed this way before. Yet there shall be a space between you and it, a distance of about two thousand cubits; do not come any nearer to it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said to the people, “Sanctify yourselves, for tomorrow the Lord will do wonders among you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: To the priests Joshua said, “Take up the ark of the covenant, and pass on in front of the people.” So they took up the ark of the covenant and went in front of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Joshua, “This day I will begin to exalt you in the sight of all Israel, so that they may know that I will be with you as I was with Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are the one who shall command the priests who bear the ark of the covenant, ‘When you come to the edge of the waters of the Jordan, you shall stand still in the Jordan.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua then said to the Israelites, “Draw near and hear the words of the Lord your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said, “By this you shall know that among you is the living God who without fail will drive out from before you the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites, and Jebusites:
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth is going to pass before you into the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now select twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one from each tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the soles of the feet of the priests who bear the ark of the Lord, the Lord of all the earth, come to rest in the waters of the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan flowing from above shall be cut off; they shall stand in a single heap.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people set out from their tents to cross over the Jordan, the priests bearing the ark of the covenant were in front of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Jordan overflows all its banks throughout the time of harvest. So when those who bore the ark had come to the Jordan and the feet of the priests bearing the ark were dipped in the edge of the water,
speaker: Narrator

text: the waters flowing from above stood still, rising up in a single heap far off at Adam, the city that is beside Zarethan, while those flowing toward the sea of the Arabah, the Dead Sea, were wholly cut off. Then the people crossed over opposite Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: While all Israel were crossing over on dry ground, the priests who bore the ark of the covenant of the Lord stood firmly on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan, until the entire nation finished crossing over the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the entire nation had finished crossing over the Jordan, the Lord said to Joshua,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Select twelve men from the people, one from each tribe,
speaker: Narrator

text: and command them, ‘Take twelve stones from here out of the middle of the Jordan, from the place where the priests’ feet stood, carry them over with you, and lay them down in the place where you camp tonight.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua summoned the twelve men whom he had appointed from the Israelites, one from each tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said to them, “Pass on before the ark of the Lord your God into the middle of the Jordan, and each of you take up a stone on his shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the Israelites,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that this may be a sign among you. When your children ask in time to come, ‘What do those stones mean to you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall tell them that the waters of the Jordan were cut off in front of the ark of the covenant of the Lord. When it crossed over the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off. So these stones shall be to the Israelites a memorial forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites did as Joshua commanded. They took up twelve stones out of the middle of the Jordan, according to the number of the tribes of the Israelites, as the Lord had told Joshua, carried them over with them to the place where they camped, and laid them down there.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Joshua set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan, in the place where the feet of the priests bearing the ark of the covenant had stood, and they are there to this day.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests who bore the ark remained standing in the middle of the Jordan until everything was finished that the Lord had commanded Joshua to tell the people, according to all that Moses had commanded Joshua. The people crossed over in haste.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as all the people had finished crossing over, the ark of the Lord and the priests crossed over to the front of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh crossed over armed before the Israelites, as Moses had ordered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: About forty thousand armed for war crossed over before the Lord to the plains of Jericho for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day the Lord exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel, and they stood in awe of him, as they had stood in awe of Moses all the days of his life.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Joshua,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the priests who bear the ark of the covenant to come up out of the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua therefore commanded the priests, “Come up out of the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the priests bearing the ark of the covenant of the Lord came up from the middle of the Jordan and the soles of the priests’ feet touched dry ground, the waters of the Jordan returned to their place and overflowed all its banks, as before.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people came up out of the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and they camped in Gilgal on the east border of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those twelve stones that they had taken out of the Jordan, Joshua set up in Gilgal,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying to the Israelites, “When your children ask their parents in time to come, ‘What do these stones mean?’
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall let your children know, ‘Israel crossed over the Jordan here on dry ground.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God dried up the waters of the Jordan for you until you crossed over, as the Lord your God did to the Red Sea, which he dried up for us until we crossed over,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that all the peoples of the earth may know that the hand of the Lord is mighty and so that you may fear the Lord your God forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the kings of the Amorites beyond the Jordan to the west and all the kings of the Canaanites by the sea heard that the Lord had dried up the waters of the Jordan for the Israelites until they had crossed over, their hearts melted, and there was no longer any spirit in them because of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time the Lord said to Joshua, “Make flint knives and circumcise the Israelites a second time.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua made flint knives and circumcised the Israelites at Gibeath-haaraloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the reason why Joshua circumcised them: all the males of the people who came out of Egypt, all the warriors, had died during the journey through the wilderness after they had come out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Although all the people who came out had been circumcised, yet all the people born on the journey through the wilderness after they had come out of Egypt had not been circumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Israelites traveled forty years in the wilderness, until all the nation, the warriors who came out of Egypt, perished, not having listened to the voice of the Lord. To them the Lord swore that he would not let them see the land that he had sworn to their ancestors to give us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it was their children, whom he raised up in their place, that Joshua circumcised, for they were uncircumcised because they had not been circumcised on the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the circumcising of all the nation was done, they remained in their places in the camp until they were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away from you the disgrace of Egypt.” And so that place is called Gilgal to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: While the Israelites were camped in Gilgal, they kept the Passover in the evening on the fourteenth day of the month in the plains of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the day after the Passover, on that very day, they ate the produce of the land, unleavened cakes and roasted grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The manna ceased on the day they ate the produce of the land, and the Israelites no longer had manna; they ate the crops of the land of Canaan that year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once when Joshua was by Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing before him with a drawn sword in his hand. Joshua went to him and said to him, “Are you one of us or one of our adversaries?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He replied, “Neither, but as commander of the army of the Lord I have now come.” And Joshua fell on his face to the earth and worshiped, and he said to him, “What do you command your servant, my lord?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The commander of the army of the Lord said to Joshua, “Remove the sandals from your feet, for the place where you stand is holy.” And Joshua did so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jericho was shut up inside and out because of the Israelites; no one came out, and no one went in.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Joshua, “See, I have handed Jericho over to you, along with its king and soldiers.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall march around the city, all the warriors circling the city once. Thus you shall do for six days,
speaker: Narrator

text: with seven priests bearing seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark. On the seventh day you shall march around the city seven times, the priests blowing the trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they make a long blast with the ram’s horn, as soon as you hear the sound of the trumpet, then all the people shall shout with a great shout, and the wall of the city will fall down flat, and all the people shall charge straight ahead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua son of Nun summoned the priests and said to them, “Take up the ark of the covenant and have seven priests carry seven trumpets of rams’ horns in front of the ark of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: To the people he said, “Go forward and march around the city; have the armed men pass on before the ark of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Joshua had commanded the people, the seven priests carrying the seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the Lord went forward, blowing the trumpets, with the ark of the covenant of the Lord following them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the armed men went before the priests who blew the trumpets; the rear guard came after the ark, while the trumpets blew continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the people Joshua gave this command: “You shall not shout or let your voice be heard, nor shall you utter a word until the day I tell you to shout. Then you shall shout.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the ark of the Lord went around the city, circling it once, and they came into the camp and spent the night in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up the ark of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seven priests carrying the seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the Lord passed on, blowing the trumpets continually. The armed men went before them, and the rear guard came after the ark of the Lord, while the trumpets blew continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the second day they marched around the city once and then returned to the camp. They did this for six days.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the seventh day they rose early, at dawn, and marched around the city in the same manner seven times. It was only on that day that they marched around the city seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the seventh time, when the priests had blown the trumpets, Joshua said to the people, “Shout! For the Lord has given you the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: The city and all that is in it shall be devoted to the Lord for destruction. Only Rahab the prostitute and all who are with her in her house shall live because she hid the messengers we sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, keep away from the things devoted to destruction, so as not to covet and take any of the devoted things and make the camp of Israel an object for destruction, bringing trouble upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all silver and gold and vessels of bronze and iron are sacred to the Lord; they shall go into the treasury of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people shouted, and the trumpets were blown. As soon as the people heard the sound of the trumpets, they raised a great shout, and the wall fell down flat, so the people charged straight ahead into the city and captured it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they devoted to destruction by the edge of the sword all in the city, both men and women, young and old, oxen, sheep, and donkeys.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the two men who had spied out the land, Joshua said, “Go into the prostitute’s house, and bring the woman out of it and all who belong to her, as you swore to her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the young men who had been spies went in and brought Rahab out, along with her father, her mother, her brothers, and all who belonged to her—they brought all her kindred out—and set them outside the camp of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They burned down the city and everything in it; only the silver and gold and the vessels of bronze and iron they put into the treasury of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Rahab the prostitute, with her family and all who belonged to her, Joshua spared. Her family has lived in Israel ever since. For she hid the messengers whom Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Joshua then pronounced this oath, saying,
“Cursed before the Lord be anyone who tries
    to build this city, Jericho!
At the cost of his firstborn he shall lay its foundation,
    and at the cost of his youngest he shall set up its gates!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord was with Joshua, and his fame was in all the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Israelites broke faith in regard to the devoted things: Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took some of the devoted things, and the anger of the Lord burned against the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is near Beth-aven, east of Bethel, and said to them, “Go up and spy out the land.” And the men went up and spied out Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they returned to Joshua and said to him, “Not all the people need go up; about two or three thousand men should go up and attack Ai. Since they are so few, do not make the whole people toil up there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So about three thousand of the people went up there, and they fled before the men of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of Ai killed about thirty-six of them, chasing them from outside the gate as far as Shebarim and killing them on the slope. The hearts of the people melted and turned to water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua tore his clothes and fell to the ground on his face before the ark of the Lord until the evening, he and the elders of Israel, and they put dust on their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said, “Ah, Lord God! Why have you brought this people across the Jordan at all, to hand us over to the Amorites so as to destroy us? Would that we had been content to settle beyond the Jordan!
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, what can I say, now that Israel has turned their backs to their enemies!
speaker: Narrator

text: The Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear of it and surround us and cut off our name from the earth. Then what will you do for your great name?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Stand up! Why have you fallen on your face?
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel has sinned; they have transgressed my covenant that I imposed on them. They have taken some of the devoted things; they have stolen, they have acted deceitfully, and they have put them among their own belongings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Israelites are unable to stand before their enemies; they turn their backs to their enemies because they have become a thing devoted for destruction themselves. I will be with you no more unless you destroy the devoted things from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Proceed to sanctify the people and say, ‘Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, for thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: There are devoted things among you, O Israel; you will be unable to stand before your enemies until you take away the devoted things from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning, therefore, you shall come forward tribe by tribe. The tribe that the Lord takes shall come near by clans, the clan that the Lord takes shall come near by households, and the household that the Lord takes shall come near one by one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the one who is taken as having the devoted things shall be burned with fire, together with all that he has, for having transgressed the covenant of the Lord and for having done an outrageous thing in Israel.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua rose early in the morning and brought Israel near tribe by tribe, and the tribe of Judah was taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought near the clans of Judah, and the clan of the Zerahites was taken, and he brought near the clan of the Zerahites by households, and Zabdi was taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought near his household one by one, and Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said to Achan, “My son, give glory to the Lord God of Israel and make confession to him. Tell me now what you have done; do not hide it from me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Achan answered Joshua, “It is true; I am the one who sinned against the Lord God of Israel. This is what I did:
speaker: Narrator

text: when I saw among the spoil a beautiful mantle from Shinar and two hundred shekels of silver and a bar of gold weighing fifty shekels, then I coveted them and took them. They now lie hidden in the ground inside my tent, with the silver underneath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent, and there it was, hidden in his tent with the silver underneath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took them out of the tent and brought them to Joshua and all the Israelites, and they spread them out before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him took Achan son of Zerah, with the silver, the mantle, and the bar of gold, with his sons and daughters, with his oxen, donkeys, and sheep, and his tent and all that he had, and they brought them up to the Valley of Achor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said, “Why did you bring trouble on us? The Lord is bringing trouble on you today.” And all Israel stoned him to death; they burned them with fire, cast stones on them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and raised over him a great heap of stones that remains to this day. Then the Lord turned from his burning anger. Therefore that place to this day is called the Valley of Achor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Do not fear or be dismayed; take all the fighting men with you, and go up to Ai. See, I have handed over to you the king of Ai with his people, his city, and his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall do to Ai and its king as you did to Jericho and its king, except that you may take its spoil and plunder its livestock for yourselves. Set an ambush against the city, behind it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua and all the fighting men set out to go up against Ai. Joshua chose thirty thousand warriors and sent them out by night
speaker: Narrator

text: with the command, “You shall lie in ambush against the city, behind it; do not go very far from the city, but all of you stay alert.
speaker: Narrator

text: I and all the people who are with me will approach the city. When they come out against us, as before, we will flee from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will come out after us until we have drawn them away from the city, for they will say, ‘They are fleeing from us as before.’ While we flee from them,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall rise up from the ambush and seize the city, for the Lord your God will give it into your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you have taken the city, you shall set the city on fire, doing as the Lord has ordered; see, I have commanded you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua sent them out, and they went to the place of ambush and lay between Bethel and Ai, to the west of Ai, but Joshua spent that night with the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning Joshua rose early and mustered the people and went up, with the elders of Israel, before the people to Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the fighting men who were with him went up and drew near before the city and camped on the north side of Ai, with a ravine between them and Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Taking about five thousand men, he set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, to the west of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they stationed the forces, the main encampment that was north of the city and its rear guard west of the city, and Joshua went that night into the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the king of Ai saw this, he and all his people, the inhabitants of the city, hurried out early in the morning to the meeting place facing the Arabah to meet Israel in battle, but he did not know that there was an ambush against him behind the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua and all Israel made a pretense of being beaten before them and fled in the direction of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the people who were in the city were called together to pursue them, and as they pursued Joshua they were drawn away from the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was not a man left in Ai who did not go out after Israel; they left the city open and pursued Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Stretch out the sword that is in your hand toward Ai, for I will give it into your hand.” And Joshua stretched out the sword that was in his hand toward the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as he stretched out his hand, the troops in ambush rose quickly out of their place and rushed forward. They entered the city, took it, and at once set the city on fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the men of Ai looked back, the smoke of the city was rising to the sky. They had no power to flee this way or that, for the people who fled to the wilderness turned back against the pursuers.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city and that the smoke of the city was rising, then they turned back and struck down the men of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the other Israelites came out from the city against them, so they were surrounded by Israelites, some on one side and some on the other, and Israel struck them down until no one was left who survived or escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the king of Ai was taken alive and brought to Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Israel had finished killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the open wilderness where they pursued them, and when all of them to the very last had fallen by the edge of the sword, all Israel returned to Ai and attacked it with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total of those who fell that day, both men and women, was twelve thousand—all the people of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Joshua did not draw back his hand with which he stretched out the sword until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the livestock and the spoil of that city Israel plundered for themselves, according to the word of the Lord that he had issued to Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua burned Ai and made it forever a heap of ruins, as it is to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hanged the king of Ai on a tree until evening, and at sunset Joshua commanded, and they took his body down from the tree, threw it down at the entrance of the gate of the city, and raised over it a great heap of stones, which stands there to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua built on Mount Ebal an altar to the Lord, the God of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded the Israelites, as it is written in the book of the law of Moses, “an altar of unhewn stones, on which no iron tool has been used,” and they offered on it burnt offerings to the Lord and sacrificed offerings of well-being.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there, in the presence of the Israelites, Joshua wrote on the stones a copy of the law of Moses that he had written.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Israel, alien as well as native-born, with their elders and officers and their judges, stood on opposite sides of the ark in front of the Levitical priests who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord, half of them in front of Mount Gerizim and half of them in front of Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded earlier, that they should bless the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward he read all the words of the law, blessings and curses, according to all that is written in the book of the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was not a word of all that Moses commanded that Joshua did not read before all the assembly of Israel, and the women, and the little ones, and the aliens who resided among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when all the kings who were beyond the Jordan in the hill country and in the lowland all along the coast of the Great Sea toward Lebanon—the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites—heard of this,
speaker: Narrator

text: they gathered together with one accord to fight Joshua and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and to Ai,
speaker: Narrator

text: they on their part acted with cunning: they went and prepared provisions and took worn-out sacks for their donkeys and wineskins, worn out and torn and mended,
speaker: Narrator

text: with worn-out, patched sandals on their feet and worn-out clothes, and all their provisions were dry and moldy.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal and said to him and to the Israelites, “We have come from a far country, so now make a treaty with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Israelites said to the Hivites, “Perhaps you live among us; then how can we make a treaty with you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Joshua, “We are your servants.” And Joshua said to them, “Who are you? And where do you come from?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “Your servants have come from a very far country because of the name of the Lord your God, for we have heard a report of him, of all that he did in Egypt
speaker: Narrator

text: and of all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan who lived in Ashtaroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: So our elders and all the inhabitants of our country said to us, ‘Take provisions in your hand for the journey; go to meet them, and say to them, “We are your servants; come now, make a treaty with us.” ’
speaker: Narrator

text: Here is our bread; it was still warm when we took it from our houses as our food for the journey, on the day we set out to come to you, but now, see, it is dry and moldy;
speaker: Narrator

text: these wineskins were new when we filled them, and see, they are burst, and these garments and sandals of ours are worn out from the very long journey.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the leaders partook of their provisions and did not ask direction from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua made peace with them, guaranteeing their lives by a treaty, and the leaders of the congregation swore an oath to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when three days had passed after they had made a treaty with them, they heard that they were their neighbors and were living among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites set out and reached their cities on the third day. Now their cities were Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath-jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Israelites did not attack them because the leaders of the congregation had sworn to them by the Lord, the God of Israel. Then all the congregation murmured against the leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the leaders said to all the congregation, “We have sworn to them by the Lord, the God of Israel, and now we must not touch them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what we will do to them: we will let them live, so that wrath may not come upon us, because of the oath that we swore to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The leaders said to them, “Let them live.” So they became woodcutters and drawers of water for all the congregation, as the leaders had decided concerning them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua summoned them and said to them, “Why did you deceive us, saying, ‘We are very far from you,’ while in fact you are living among us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, you are cursed, and some of you shall always be slaves, woodcutters and drawers of water for the house of my God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered Joshua, “Because it was told to your servants for a certainty that the Lord your God had commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land before you, so we were in great fear for our lives because of you and did this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now we are in your hand: do as it seems good and right in your sight to do to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what he did for them: he saved them from the Israelites, and they did not kill them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But on that day Joshua made them woodcutters and drawers of water for the congregation and for the altar of the Lord, to continue to this day, in the place that he should choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: When King Adoni-zedek of Jerusalem heard how Joshua had taken Ai and had utterly destroyed it, doing to Ai and its king as he had done to Jericho and its king, and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and were among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: he became greatly frightened, because Gibeon was a large city, like one of the royal cities, and was larger than Ai, and all its men were warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: So King Adoni-zedek of Jerusalem sent a message to King Hoham of Hebron, to King Piram of Jarmuth, to King Japhia of Lachish, and to King Debir of Eglon, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come up and help me, and let us attack Gibeon, for it has made peace with Joshua and with the Israelites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the five kings of the Amorites—the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon—gathered their forces and went up with all their armies and camped against Gibeon and made war against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Gibeonites sent to Joshua at the camp in Gilgal, saying, “Do not abandon your servants; come up to us quickly and save us and help us, for all the kings of the Amorites who live in the hill country are gathered against us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua went up from Gilgal, he and all the fighting force with him, all the mighty warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Do not fear them, for I have handed them over to you; not one of them shall stand before you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua came upon them suddenly, having marched up all night from Gilgal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord threw them into a panic before Israel, who inflicted a crushing blow on them at Gibeon, chased them by the way of the ascent of Beth-horon, and struck them down as far as Azekah and Makkedah.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they fled before Israel, while they were going down the slope of Beth-horon, the Lord threw down huge stones from heaven on them as far as Azekah, and they died; there were more who died because of the hailstones than the Israelites killed with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On the day when the Lord gave the Amorites over to the Israelites, Joshua spoke to the Lord, and he said in the sight of Israel,
“Sun, stand still at Gibeon,
    and Moon, in the valley of Aijalon.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the sun stood still, and the moon stopped
    until the nation took vengeance on their enemies.
Is this not written in the Book of Jashar? The sun stopped in midheaven and did not hurry to set for about a whole day.
speaker: Narrator

text: There has been no day like it before or since, when the Lord heeded a human voice, for the Lord fought for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to the camp at Gilgal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, these five kings fled and hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told Joshua, “The five kings have been found, hidden in the cave at Makkedah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said, “Roll large stones against the mouth of the cave, and set men by it to guard them,
speaker: Narrator

text: but do not stay there yourselves; pursue your enemies and attack them from the rear. Do not let them enter their towns, for the Lord your God has given them into your hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joshua and the Israelites had finished inflicting a very great blow on them, until they were wiped out, and when the survivors had entered into the fortified towns,
speaker: Narrator

text: all the people returned safe to Joshua in the camp at Makkedah; no one dared to speak against any of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said, “Open the mouth of the cave and bring those five kings out to me from the cave.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They did so and brought the five kings out to him from the cave, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they brought the kings out to Joshua, Joshua summoned all the Israelites and said to the chiefs of the warriors who had gone with him, “Come near, put your feet on the necks of these kings.” Then they came near and put their feet on their necks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to them, “Do not be afraid or dismayed; be strong and courageous, for thus the Lord will do to all the enemies against whom you fight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Joshua struck them down and put them to death, and he hung them on five trees. And they hung on the trees until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: At sunset Joshua commanded, and they took them down from the trees and threw them into the cave where they had hidden themselves; they set large stones against the mouth of the cave that remain to this very day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua took Makkedah on that day and struck it and its king with the edge of the sword; he utterly destroyed every person in it; he left no one remaining. And he did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua passed on from Makkedah, and all Israel with him, to Libnah and fought against Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gave it also and its king into the hand of Israel, and he struck it with the edge of the sword, and every person in it; he left no one remaining in it, and he did to its king as he had done to the king of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next Joshua passed on from Libnah, and all Israel with him, to Lachish and laid siege to it and assaulted it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gave Lachish into the hand of Israel, and he took it on the second day and struck it with the edge of the sword, and every person in it, as he had done to Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King Horam of Gezer came up to help Lachish, and Joshua struck him and his people, leaving him no survivors.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Lachish Joshua passed on with all Israel to Eglon, and they laid siege to it and assaulted it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they took it that day and struck it with the edge of the sword, and every person in it he utterly destroyed that day, as he had done to Lachish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua went up with all Israel from Eglon to Hebron; they assaulted it
speaker: Narrator

text: and took it and struck it with the edge of the sword, and its king and its towns and every person in it; he left no one remaining, just as he had done to Eglon, and utterly destroyed it with every person in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua, with all Israel, turned back to Debir and assaulted it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he took it with its king and all its towns; they struck them with the edge of the sword and utterly destroyed every person in it; he left no one remaining; just as he had done to Hebron and as he had done to Libnah and its king, so he did to Debir and its king.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua defeated the whole land, the hill country and the Negeb and the lowland and the slopes and all their kings; he left no one remaining but utterly destroyed all that breathed, as the Lord God of Israel had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua defeated them from Kadesh-barnea to Gaza and all the country of Goshen, as far as Gibeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua took all these kings and their land at one time because the Lord God of Israel fought for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to the camp at Gilgal.
speaker: Narrator

text: When King Jabin of Hazor heard of this, he sent to King Jobab of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to the kings who were in the northern hill country, and in the Arabah south of Chinneroth, and in the lowland, and in Naphoth-dor on the west,
speaker: Narrator

text: to the Canaanites in the east and the west, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, and the Jebusites in the hill country, and the Hivites under Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came out, with all their troops, a great army, in number like the sand on the seashore, with very many horses and chariots.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these kings joined their forces and came and camped together at the waters of Merom, to fight with Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, for tomorrow at this time I will hand over all of them, slain, to Israel; you shall hamstring their horses and burn their chariots with fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua came suddenly upon them with all his fighting force, by the waters of Merom, and fell upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord handed them over to Israel, who attacked them and chased them as far as Great Sidon and Misrephoth-maim and eastward as far as the valley of Mizpeh. They struck them down until they had left no one remaining.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua did to them as the Lord had commanded him; he hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua turned back at that time and took Hazor and struck its king down with the sword. Before that time Hazor was the head of all those kingdoms.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they put to the sword all who were in it, utterly destroying them; there was no one left who breathed, and he burned Hazor with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the towns of those kings and all their kings, Joshua took and struck them with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them, as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Israel burned none of the towns that stood on mounds except Hazor, which Joshua did burn.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the spoil of these towns and the livestock the Israelites plundered for themselves, but all the people they struck down with the edge of the sword, until they had destroyed them, and they did not leave any who breathed.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Lord had commanded his servant Moses, so Moses commanded Joshua, and so Joshua did; he left nothing undone of all that the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua took all that land: the hill country and all the Negeb and all the land of Goshen and the lowland and the Arabah and the hill country of Israel and its lowland,
speaker: Narrator

text: from Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir, as far as Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon below Mount Hermon. He took all their kings, struck them down, and put them to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua made war a long time with all those kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was not a town that made peace with the Israelites except the Hivites, the inhabitants of Gibeon; all were taken in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it was the Lord’s doing to harden their hearts so that they would come against Israel in battle, in order that they might be utterly destroyed and might receive no mercy but be exterminated, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Joshua came and wiped out the Anakim from the hill country, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the hill country of Judah, and from all the hill country of Israel; Joshua utterly destroyed them with their towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: None of the Anakim was left in the land of the Israelites; some remained only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that the Lord had spoken to Moses, and Joshua gave it for an inheritance to Israel according to their tribal allotments. And the land had rest from war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the kings of the land whom the Israelites defeated, whose land they occupied beyond the Jordan toward the east, from the Wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon, with all the Arabah eastward:
speaker: Narrator

text: King Sihon of the Amorites who lived at Heshbon and ruled from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Wadi Arnon, and from the middle of the valley as far as the Wadi Jabbok, the boundary of the Ammonites, that is, half of Gilead,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Arabah to the Sea of Chinneroth eastward, and in the direction of Beth-jeshimoth, to the sea of the Arabah, the Dead Sea, southward to the foot of the slopes of Pisgah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and King Og of Bashan, one of the last of the Rephaim, who lived at Ashtaroth and at Edrei
speaker: Narrator

text: and ruled over Mount Hermon and Salecah and all Bashan to the boundary of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and over half of Gilead to the boundary of King Sihon of Heshbon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses, the servant of the Lord, and the Israelites defeated them, and Moses the servant of the Lord gave their land for a possession to the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The following are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the Israelites defeated on the west side of the Jordan, from Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon to Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir (and Joshua gave their land to the tribes of Israel as a possession according to their allotments,
speaker: Narrator

text: in the hill country, in the lowland, in the Arabah, in the slopes, in the wilderness, and in the Negeb, the land of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites):
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Jericho onethe king of Ai, which is next to Bethel one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Jerusalem onethe king of Hebron one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Jarmuth onethe king of Lachish one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Eglon onethe king of Gezer one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Debir onethe king of Geder one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Hormah onethe king of Arad one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Libnah onethe king of Adullam one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Makkedah onethe king of Bethel one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Tappuah onethe king of Hepher one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Aphek onethe king of Lasharon one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Madon onethe king of Hazor one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Shimron-meron onethe king of Achshaph one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Taanach onethe king of Megiddo one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Kedesh onethe king of Jokneam in Carmel one
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Dor in Naphath-dor onethe king of Goiim in Galilee, one
speaker: Narrator

text:
the king of Tirzah one
thirty-one kings in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Joshua was old and advanced in years, and the Lord said to him, “You are old and advanced in years, and very much of the land still remains to be possessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the land that still remains: all the regions of the Philistines, and all those of the Geshurites
speaker: Narrator

text: (from the Shihor, which is near Egypt, northward to the boundary of Ekron, it is reckoned as Canaanite; there are five rulers of the Philistines, those of Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron), and those of the Avvim
speaker: Narrator

text: in the south; all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah that belongs to the Sidonians, to Aphek, to the boundary of the Amorites,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the land of the Gebalites, and all Lebanon, toward the east, from Baal-gad below Mount Hermon to Lebo-hamath,
speaker: Narrator

text: all the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim, even all the Sidonians. I will myself drive them out from before the Israelites; only allot the land to Israel for an inheritance, as I have commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, divide this land for an inheritance to the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: With the other half-tribe of Manasseh the Reubenites and the Gadites received their inheritance, which Moses gave them, beyond the Jordan eastward, as Moses the servant of the Lord gave them:
speaker: Narrator

text: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Wadi Arnon, and the town that is in the middle of the valley, and all the tableland from Medeba as far as Dibon;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the cities of King Sihon of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, as far as the boundary of the Ammonites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Gilead, and the region of the Geshurites and Maacathites, and all Mount Hermon, and all Bashan to Salecah;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and in Edrei (he alone was left of the survivors of the Rephaim); these Moses had defeated and driven out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the Israelites did not drive out the Geshurites or the Maacathites, but Geshur and Maacath live within Israel to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the tribe of Levi alone Moses gave no inheritance; the offerings by fire to the Lord God of Israel are their inheritance, as he said to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave an inheritance to the tribe of the Reubenites according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their territory was from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Wadi Arnon, and the town that is in the middle of the valley, and all the tableland by Medeba;
speaker: Narrator

text: with Heshbon, and all its towns that are in the tableland; Dibon, and Bamoth-baal, and Beth-baal-meon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jahaz, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Kiriathaim, and Sibmah, and Zereth-shahar on the hill of the valley,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Beth-peor, and the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: that is, all the towns of the tableland, and all the kingdom of King Sihon of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, whom Moses defeated with the leaders of Midian, Evi and Rekem and Zur and Hur and Reba, as princes of Sihon, who lived in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Along with the rest of those they put to death, the Israelites also put to the sword Balaam son of Beor, who practiced divination.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the border of the Reubenites was the Jordan and its banks. This was the inheritance of the Reubenites according to their families, with their towns and villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave an inheritance also to the tribe of the Gadites, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their territory was Jazer, and all the towns of Gilead, and half the land of the Ammonites, to Aroer, which is near Rabbah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the territory of Debir,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the valley Beth-haram, Beth-nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of King Sihon of Heshbon, the Jordan and its banks, as far as the lower end of the Sea of Chinnereth, eastward beyond the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the Gadites according to their families, with their towns and villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave an inheritance to the half-tribe of Manasseh; it was allotted to the half-tribe of the Manassites according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their territory extended from Mahanaim, through all Bashan, the whole kingdom of King Og of Bashan, and all the settlements of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty towns,
speaker: Narrator

text: and half of Gilead, and Ashtaroth, and Edrei, the towns of the kingdom of Og in Bashan; these were allotted to the people of Machir son of Manasseh according to their families, for half the Machirites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the inheritances that Moses distributed in the plains of Moab, beyond the Jordan east of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the tribe of Levi Moses gave no inheritance; the Lord God of Israel is their inheritance, as he said to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the inheritances that the Israelites received in the land of Canaan, which the priest Eleazar, and Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the families of the tribes of the Israelites distributed to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their inheritance was by lot, as the Lord had commanded Moses for the nine and one-half tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Moses had given an inheritance to the two and one-half tribes beyond the Jordan, but to the Levites he gave no inheritance among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the people of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, and no portion was given to the Levites in the land but only towns to live in, with their pasturelands for their flocks and herds.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites did as the Lord had commanded Moses; they allotted the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people of Judah came to Joshua at Gilgal, and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, “You know what the Lord said to Moses the man of God in Kadesh-barnea concerning you and me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was forty years old when Moses the servant of the Lord sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land, and I brought him an honest report.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my companions who went up with me made the heart of the people melt, yet I wholeheartedly followed the Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses swore on that day, saying, ‘Surely the land on which your foot has trodden shall be an inheritance for you and your children forever, because you have wholeheartedly followed the Lord my God.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, as you see, the Lord has kept me alive, as he said, these forty-five years since the time that the Lord spoke this word to Moses, while Israel was journeying through the wilderness, and here I am today, eighty-five years old.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am still as strong today as I was on the day that Moses sent me; my strength now is as my strength was then, for war and for going and coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now give me this hill country of which the Lord spoke on that day, for you heard on that day how the Anakim were there, with great fortified cities; it may be that the Lord will be with me, and I will drive them out, as the Lord said.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua blessed him and gave Hebron to Caleb son of Jephunneh for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day, because he wholeheartedly followed the Lord, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the name of Hebron formerly was Kiriath-arba; Arba was the greatest man among the Anakim. And the land had rest from war.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lot for the tribe of the people of Judah according to their families reached southward to the boundary of Edom, to the wilderness of Zin at the farthest south.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their south boundary ran from the end of the Dead Sea, from the bay that faces southward;
speaker: Narrator

text: it goes out southward of the ascent of Akrabbim, passes along to Zin, and goes up south of Kadesh-barnea, along by Hezron, up to Addar, makes a turn to Karka,
speaker: Narrator

text: passes along to Azmon, goes out by the Wadi of Egypt, and comes to its end at the sea. This shall be your south boundary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the east boundary is the Dead Sea, to the mouth of the Jordan. And the boundary on the north side runs from the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the boundary goes up to Beth-hoglah and passes along north of Beth-arabah; and the boundary goes up to the Stone of Bohan, Reuben’s son;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the boundary goes up to Debir from the Valley of Achor, and so northward, turning toward Gilgal, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim, which is on the south side of the valley; and the boundary passes along to the waters of En-shemesh, and ends at En-rogel;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the boundary goes up by the valley of the son of Hinnom at the southern slope of the Jebusites (that is, Jerusalem); and the boundary goes up to the top of the mountain that lies over against the valley of Hinnom, on the west, at the northern end of the valley of Rephaim;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the boundary extends from the top of the mountain to the spring of the Waters of Nephtoah, and from there to the towns of Mount Ephron; then the boundary bends around to Baalah (that is, Kiriath-jearim);
speaker: Narrator

text: and the boundary circles west of Baalah to Mount Seir, passes along to the northern slope of Mount Jearim (that is, Chesalon), and goes down to Beth-shemesh, and passes along by Timnah;
speaker: Narrator

text: the boundary goes out to the slope of the hill north of Ekron, then the boundary bends around to Shikkeron, and passes along to Mount Baalah, and goes out to Jabneel; then the boundary comes to an end at the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the west boundary is the Mediterranean with its coast. This is the boundary surrounding the people of Judah according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to Caleb son of Jephunneh, Joshua gave a portion among the people of Judah according to the commandment of the Lord to Joshua, Kiriath-arba, that is, Hebron (Arba was the father of Anak).
speaker: Narrator

text: And Caleb drove out from there the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there he went up against the inhabitants of Debir; now the name of Debir formerly was Kiriath-sepher.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Caleb said, “Whoever attacks Kiriath-sepher and takes it, to him I will give my daughter Achsah as wife.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Othniel son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, took it, and he gave him his daughter Achsah as wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she came to him, she urged him to ask her father for a field. As she dismounted from her donkey, Caleb said to her, “What do you wish?”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said to him, “Give me a present; since you have set me in the land of the Negeb, give me springs of water as well.” So Caleb gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the people of Judah according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns belonging to the tribe of the people of Judah in the extreme south, toward the boundary of Edom, were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hazor-hadattah, Kerioth-hezron (that is, Hazor),
speaker: Narrator

text: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hazar-gaddah, Heshmon, Beth-pelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hazar-shual, Beer-sheba, Biziothiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon: in all, twenty-nine towns, with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the lowland, Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zanoah, En-gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaaraim, Adithaim, Gederah, Gederothaim: fourteen towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal-gad,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dilan, Mizpeh, Jokthe-el,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Cabbon, Lahmam, Chitlish,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gederoth, Beth-dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah: sixteen towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
speaker: Narrator

text: Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah: nine towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ekron, with its towns and its villages;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Ekron to the sea, all that were near Ashdod, with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashdod, its towns and its villages; Gaza, its towns and its villages; to the Wadi of Egypt, and the Great Sea with its coast.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the hill country, Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dannah, Kiriath-sannah (that is, Debir),
speaker: Narrator

text: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh: eleven towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Janim, Beth-tappuah, Aphekah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Humtah, Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), and Zior: nine towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah: ten towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halhul, Beth-zur, Gedor,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maarath, Beth-anoth, and Eltekon: six towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kiriath-baal (that is, Kiriath-jearim) and Rabbah: two towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the wilderness, Beth-arabah, Middin, Secacah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nibshan, the City of Salt, and En-gedi: six towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the people of Judah could not drive out the Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so the Jebusites live with the people of Judah in Jerusalem to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The allotment of the Josephites went from the Jordan by Jericho, east of the waters of Jericho, into the wilderness, going up from Jericho into the hill country to Bethel;
speaker: Narrator

text: then going from Bethel to Luz, it passes along to Ataroth, the territory of the Archites;
speaker: Narrator

text: then it goes down westward to the territory of the Japhletites, as far as the territory of Lower Beth-horon, then to Gezer, and it ends at the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Josephites—Manasseh and Ephraim—received their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The territory of the Ephraimites by their families was as follows: the boundary of their inheritance on the east was Ataroth-addar as far as Upper Beth-horon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the boundary goes from there to the sea; on the north is Michmethath; then on the east the boundary makes a turn toward Taanath-shiloh and passes along beyond it on the east to Janoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it goes down from Janoah to Ataroth and to Naarah and touches Jericho, ending at the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Tappuah the boundary goes westward to the Wadi Kanah and ends at the sea. Such is the inheritance of the tribe of the Ephraimites by their families,
speaker: Narrator

text: together with the towns that were set apart for the Ephraimites within the inheritance of the Manassites, all those towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not, however, drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer, so the Canaanites have lived within Ephraim to this day but have been made to do forced labor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then allotment was made to the tribe of Manasseh, for he was the firstborn of Joseph. To Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, were allotted Gilead and Bashan, because he was a warrior.
speaker: Narrator

text: And allotments were made to the rest of the tribe of Manasseh by their families, Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida; these were the male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph by their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Zelophehad son of Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh had no sons but only daughters, and these are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came before the priest Eleazar and Joshua son of Nun and the leaders and said, “The Lord commanded Moses to give us an inheritance along with our male kin.” So according to the commandment of the Lord he gave them an inheritance among the kinsmen of their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus there fell to Manasseh ten portions, besides the land of Gilead and Bashan, which is on the other side of the Jordan,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the daughters of Manasseh received an inheritance along with his sons. The land of Gilead was allotted to the rest of the Manassites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The territory of Manasseh reached from Asher to Michmethath, which is east of Shechem; then the boundary goes along southward to the inhabitants of En-tappuah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh, but the town of Tappuah on the boundary of Manasseh belonged to the Ephraimites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the boundary went down to the Wadi Kanah. The towns here, to the south of the wadi, among the towns of Manasseh, belong to Ephraim. Then the boundary of Manasseh goes along the north side of the wadi and ends at the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land to the south is Ephraim’s and that to the north is Manasseh’s, with the sea forming its boundary; on the north Asher is reached and on the east Issachar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within Issachar and Asher, Manasseh had Beth-shean and its villages, Ibleam and its villages, the inhabitants of Dor and its villages, the inhabitants of En-dor and its villages, the inhabitants of Taanach and its villages, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its villages (the third is Naphath).
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the Manassites could not take possession of those towns, but the Canaanites continued to live in that land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Israelites grew strong, they put the Canaanites to forced labor but did not utterly drive them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Joseph spoke to Joshua, saying, “Why have you given me but one lot and one portion as an inheritance, since we are a numerous people, whom all along the Lord has blessed?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to them, “If you are a numerous people, go up to the forest and clear ground there for yourselves in the land of the Perizzites and the Rephaim, since the hill country of Ephraim is too narrow for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Joseph said, “The hill country is not enough for us, yet all the Canaanites who live in the plain have chariots of iron, both those in Beth-shean and its villages and those in the Valley of Jezreel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said to the house of Joseph, to Ephraim and Manasseh, “You are indeed a numerous people and have great power; you shall not have one lot only,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the hill country shall be yours, for though it is a forest, you shall clear it and possess it to its farthest borders, for you shall drive out the Canaanites, though they have chariots of iron and though they are strong.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the whole congregation of the Israelites assembled at Shiloh and set up the tent of meeting there. The land lay subdued before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: There remained among the Israelites seven tribes whose inheritance had not yet been apportioned.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua said to the Israelites, “How long will you be slack about going in and taking possession of the land that the Lord, the God of your ancestors, has given you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Provide three men from each tribe, and I will send them out that they may begin to go throughout the land, writing a description of it with a view to their inheritances. Then come back to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall divide it into seven portions, Judah continuing in its territory on the south and the house of Joseph in their territory on the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall write a description of the land in seven divisions and bring the description here to me, and I will cast lots for you here before the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites have no portion among you, for the priesthood of the Lord is their heritage, and Gad and Reuben and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan eastward, which Moses the servant of the Lord gave them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the men started on their way, and Joshua charged those who went to write the description of the land, saying, “Go throughout the land and write a description of it and come back to me, and I will cast lots for you here before the Lord in Shiloh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the men went and traversed the land and set down in a book a description of it by towns in seven divisions; then they came back to Joshua in the camp at Shiloh,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before the Lord, and there Joshua apportioned the land to the Israelites, to each a portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lot of the tribe of Benjamin according to its families came up, and the territory allotted to it fell between the tribe of Judah and the tribe of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the north side their boundary began at the Jordan; then the boundary goes up to the slope of Jericho on the north, then up through the hill country westward; and it ends at the wilderness of Beth-aven.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there the boundary passes along southward in the direction of Luz, to the slope of Luz (that is, Bethel), then the boundary goes down to Ataroth-addar, on the mountain that lies south of Lower Beth-horon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the boundary goes in another direction, turning on the western side southward from the mountain that lies to the south, opposite Beth-horon, and it ends at Kiriath-baal (that is, Kiriath-jearim), a town belonging to the tribe of Judah. This forms the western side.
speaker: Narrator

text: The southern side begins at the outskirts of Kiriath-jearim on the west, and the boundary comes out at the spring of the Waters of Nephtoah;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the boundary goes down to the border of the mountain that overlooks the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is at the north end of the valley of Rephaim; and it then goes down the valley of Hinnom, south of the slope of the Jebusites, and downward to En-rogel;
speaker: Narrator

text: then it bends in a northerly direction going on to En-shemesh, and from there goes to Geliloth, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim; then it goes down to the Stone of Bohan, Reuben’s son;
speaker: Narrator

text: and passing on to the north of the slope of Beth-arabah it goes down to the Arabah;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the boundary passes on to the north of the slope of Beth-hoglah; and the boundary ends at the northern bay of the Dead Sea, at the south end of the Jordan: this is the southern border.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jordan forms its boundary on the eastern side. This is the inheritance of the tribe of Benjamin, according to its families, boundary by boundary all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the towns of the tribe of Benjamin according to their families were Jericho, Beth-hoglah, Emek-keziz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth-arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Chephar-ammoni, Ophni, and Geba—twelve towns with their villages;
speaker: Narrator

text: Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mizpeh, Chephirah, Mozah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zela, Haeleph, Jebus (that is, Jerusalem), Gibeah, and Kiriath-jearim—fourteen towns with their villages. This is the inheritance of the tribe of Benjamin according to its families.
speaker: Narrator

text: The second lot came out for Simeon, for the tribe of Simeon, according to its families; its inheritance lay within the inheritance of the tribe of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: It had for its inheritance Beer-sheba, Sheba, Moladah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hazar-shual, Balah, Ezem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziklag, Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth-lebaoth, and Sharuhen—thirteen towns with their villages;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan—four towns with their villages;
speaker: Narrator

text: together with all the villages all around these towns as far as Baalath-beer, Ramah of the Negeb. This was the inheritance of the tribe of Simeon according to its families.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inheritance of the tribe of Simeon formed part of the territory of Judah; because the portion of the tribe of Judah was too large for them, the tribe of Simeon obtained an inheritance within their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The third lot came up for the tribe of Zebulun, according to its families. The boundary of its inheritance reached as far as Sarid;
speaker: Narrator

text: then its boundary goes up westward, and on to Maralah, and touches Dabbesheth, then the wadi that is near Jokneam;
speaker: Narrator
