text: from Sarid it goes in the other direction eastward toward the sunrise to the boundary of Chisloth-tabor; from there it goes to Daberath, then up to Japhia;
speaker: Narrator

text: from there it passes along on the east toward the sunrise to Gath-hepher, to Eth-kazin, and going on to Rimmon it bends toward Neah;
speaker: Narrator

text: then on the north the boundary makes a turn to Hannathon, and it ends at the valley of Iphtah-el;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem—twelve towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Zebulun, according to its families, these towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fourth lot came out for Issachar, for the tribe of Issachar, according to its families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its territory included Jezreel, Chesulloth, Shunem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,
speaker: Narrator

text: Remeth, En-gannim, En-haddah, Beth-pazzez;
speaker: Narrator

text: the boundary also touches Tabor, Shahazumah, and Beth-shemesh, and its boundary ends at the Jordan—sixteen towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Issachar, according to its families, the towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fifth lot came out for the tribe of Asher according to its families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its boundary included Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal; on the west it touches Carmel and Shihor-libnath,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it turns eastward, goes to Beth-dagon, and touches Zebulun and the valley of Iphtah-el northward to Beth-emek and Neiel; then it continues in the north to Cabul,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, Kanah, as far as Great Sidon;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the boundary turns to Ramah, reaching to the fortified city of Tyre; then the boundary turns to Hosah, and it ends at the sea; Mahaleb, Achzib,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob—twenty-two towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Asher according to its families, these towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sixth lot came out for the tribe of Naphtali, for the tribe of Naphtali according to its families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And its boundary ran from Heleph, from the oak in Zaanannim, and Adami-nekeb, and Jabneel, as far as Lakkum; and it ended at the Jordan;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the boundary turns westward to Aznoth-tabor and goes from there to Hukkok, touching Zebulun at the south, and Asher on the west, and Judah on the east at the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fortified towns are Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedesh, Edrei, En-hazor,
speaker: Narrator

text: Iron, Migdal-el, Horem, Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh—nineteen towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Naphtali according to its families, the towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seventh lot came out for the tribe of Dan according to its families.
speaker: Narrator

text: The territory of its inheritance included Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir-shemesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehud, Bene-berak, Gath-rimmon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Me-jarkon, and Rakkon at the border opposite Joppa.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the territory of the Danites was lost to them, the Danites went up and fought against Leshem, and after capturing it and putting it to the sword, they took possession of it and settled in it, calling Leshem Dan, after their ancestor Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Dan, according to their families, these towns with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had finished distributing the several territories of the land as inheritances, the Israelites gave an inheritance among them to Joshua son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: By command of the Lord they gave him the town that he asked for, Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim; he rebuilt the town and settled in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the inheritances that the priest Eleazar and Joshua son of Nun and the heads of the families of the tribes of the Israelites distributed by lot at Shiloh before the Lord, at the entrance of the tent of meeting. So they finished dividing the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Joshua, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Say to the Israelites: Appoint the cities of refuge, of which I spoke to you through Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that anyone who kills a person without intent or by mistake may flee there; they shall be for you a refuge from the avenger of blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slayer shall flee to one of these cities and shall stand at the entrance of the gate of the city and explain the case to the elders of that city; then the fugitive shall be taken into the city and given a place and shall remain with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the avenger of blood is in pursuit, they shall not give up the slayer because the neighbor was killed by mistake, there having been no enmity between them before.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slayer shall remain in that city until there is a trial before the congregation, until the death of the one who is high priest at the time; then the slayer may return home, to the town in which the deed was done.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali, and Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And beyond the Jordan east of Jericho, they appointed Bezer in the wilderness on the tableland, from the tribe of Reuben, and Ramoth in Gilead, from the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan, from the tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the cities designated for all the Israelites and for the aliens residing among them, that anyone who killed a person without intent could flee there, so as not to die by the hand of the avenger of blood, until there was a trial before the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the heads of the families of the Levites came to the priest Eleazar and to Joshua son of Nun and to the heads of the families of the tribes of the Israelites;
speaker: Narrator

text: they said to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, “The Lord commanded through Moses that we be given towns to live in, along with their pasturelands for our livestock.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So by command of the Lord the Israelites gave to the Levites the following towns and pasturelands out of their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lot came out for the families of the Kohathites. So those Levites who were descendants of Aaron the priest received by lot thirteen towns from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of the Kohathites received by lot ten towns from the families of the tribe of Ephraim, from the tribe of Dan, and from the half-tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Gershonites received by lot thirteen towns from the families of the tribe of Issachar, from the tribe of Asher, from the tribe of Naphtali, and from the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Merarites according to their families received twelve towns from the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the tribe of Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: These towns and their pasturelands the Israelites gave by lot to the Levites, as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the tribe of Judah and the tribe of Simeon they gave the following towns mentioned by name,
speaker: Narrator

text: which went to the descendants of Aaron, one of the families of the Kohathites who belonged to the Levites, since the lot fell to them first.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave them Kiriath-arba (Arba being the father of Anak), that is, Hebron, in the hill country of Judah, along with the pasturelands around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the fields of the town and its villages had been given to Caleb son of Jephunneh as his holding.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the descendants of Aaron the priest they gave Hebron, the city of refuge for the slayer, with its pasturelands, Libnah with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jattir with its pasturelands, Eshtemoa with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Holon with its pasturelands, Debir with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ain with its pasturelands, Juttah with its pasturelands, and Beth-shemesh with its pasturelands—nine towns out of these two tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the tribe of Benjamin: Gibeon with its pasturelands, Geba with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Anathoth with its pasturelands, and Almon with its pasturelands—four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns of the descendants of Aaron, the priests, were thirteen in all, with their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to the rest of the Kohathites belonging to the Kohathite families of the Levites, the towns allotted to them were out of the tribe of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: To them were given Shechem, the city of refuge for the slayer, with its pasturelands in the hill country of Ephraim, Gezer with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kibzaim with its pasturelands, and Beth-horon with its pasturelands—four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the tribe of Dan: Elteke with its pasturelands, Gibbethon with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon with its pasturelands, Gath-rimmon with its pasturelands—four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Taanach with its pasturelands, and Gath-rimmon with its pasturelands—two towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns of the families of the rest of the Kohathites were ten in all, with their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Gershonites, one of the families of the Levites, were given out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with its pasturelands, the city of refuge for the slayer, and Beeshterah with its pasturelands—two towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the tribe of Issachar: Kishion with its pasturelands, Daberath with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jarmuth with its pasturelands, En-gannim with its pasturelands—four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the tribe of Asher: Mishal with its pasturelands, Abdon with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Helkath with its pasturelands, and Rehob with its pasturelands—four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with its pasturelands, the city of refuge for the slayer, Hammoth-dor with its pasturelands, and Kartan with its pasturelands—three towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns of the several families of the Gershonites were in all thirteen, with their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the rest of the Levites—the Merarite families—were given out of the tribe of Zebulun: Jokneam with its pasturelands, Kartah with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dimnah with its pasturelands, Nahalal with its pasturelands—four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the tribe of Reuben: Bezer with its pasturelands, Jahzah with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth with its pasturelands, and Mephaath with its pasturelands—four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with its pasturelands, the city of refuge for the slayer, Mahanaim with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon with its pasturelands, Jazer with its pasturelands—four towns in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the towns of the several Merarite families, that is, the remainder of the families of the Levites, those allotted to them were twelve in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns of the Levites within the holdings of the Israelites were in all forty-eight towns with their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of these towns had its pasturelands around it; so it was with all these towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the Lord gave to Israel all the land that he swore to their ancestors that he would give them, and having taken possession of it, they settled there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord gave them rest on every side, just as he had sworn to their ancestors; not one of all their enemies had withstood them, for the Lord had given all their enemies into their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not one of all the good promises that the Lord had made to the house of Israel had failed; all came to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, “You have observed all that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you and have obeyed me in all that I have commanded you;
speaker: Narrator

text: you have not forsaken your kindred these many days, down to this day, but have been careful to keep the charge of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now the Lord your God has given rest to your kindred, as he promised them; therefore turn and go to your tents in the land where your possession lies, which Moses the servant of the Lord gave you on the other side of the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take good care to observe the commandment and instruction that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you, to love the Lord your God, to walk in all his ways, to keep his commandments, and to hold fast to him, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua blessed them and sent them away, and they went to their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to the one half of the tribe of Manasseh Moses had given a possession in Bashan, but to the other half Joshua had given a possession beside their fellow Israelites in the land west of the Jordan. And when Joshua sent them away to their tents and blessed them,
speaker: Narrator

text: he said to them, “Go back to your tents with much wealth and with very much livestock, with silver, gold, bronze, and iron, and with a great quantity of clothing; divide the spoil of your enemies with your kindred.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh returned home, parting from the Israelites at Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan, to go to the land of Gilead, their own land of which they had taken possession by command of the Lord through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the region near the Jordan that lies in the land of Canaan, the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh built there an altar by the Jordan, an altar of great size.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites heard that the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh had built an altar opposite the land of Canaan, in the region near the Jordan, across from the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the people of Israel heard of it, the whole assembly of the Israelites gathered at Shiloh to make war against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Israelites sent the priest Phinehas son of Eleazar to the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, in the land of Gilead,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with him ten chiefs, one from each of the tribal families of Israel, every one of them the head of a family among the clans of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, in the land of Gilead, and they said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Thus says the whole congregation of the Lord: What is this treachery that you have committed against the God of Israel in turning away today from following the Lord, by building yourselves an altar today in rebellion against the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have we not had enough of the sin at Peor, from which even yet we have not cleansed ourselves and for which a plague came upon the congregation of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you must turn away today from following the Lord? If you rebel against the Lord today, he will be angry with the whole congregation of Israel tomorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now, if your land is unclean, cross over into the Lord’s land, where the Lord’s tabernacle now stands, and take for yourselves a possession among us; only do not rebel against the Lord or rebel against us by building yourselves an altar other than the altar of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not Achan son of Zerah break faith in the matter of the devoted things, and wrath fell upon all the congregation of Israel? And he did not perish alone for his iniquity!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh said in answer to the heads of the families of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord, God of gods! The Lord, God of gods! He knows, and let Israel itself know! If it was in rebellion or in breach of faith toward the Lord, do not spare us today
speaker: Narrator

text: for building an altar to turn away from following the Lord, or if we did so to offer burnt offerings or grain offerings or offerings of well-being on it, may the Lord himself take vengeance.
speaker: Narrator

text: No! We did it from fear that in time to come your children might say to our children, ‘What have you to do with the Lord, the God of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord has made the Jordan a boundary between us and you, you Reubenites and Gadites; you have no portion in the Lord.’ So your children might make our children cease to worship the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we said, ‘Let us now build an altar, not for burnt offering nor for sacrifice,
speaker: Narrator

text: but to be a witness between us and you and between the generations after us, that we do perform the service of the Lord in his presence with our burnt offerings and sacrifices and offerings of well-being, so that your children may never say to our children in time to come, “You have no portion in the Lord.” ’
speaker: Narrator

text: And we thought, ‘If this should be said to us or to our descendants in time to come, we could say, “Look at this copy of the altar of the Lord that our ancestors made, not for burnt offerings nor for sacrifice, but to be a witness between us and you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Far be it from us that we should rebel against the Lord and turn away this day from following the Lord by building an altar for burnt offering, grain offering, or sacrifice other than the altar of the Lord our God that stands before his tabernacle!’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the priest Phinehas and the chiefs of the congregation, the heads of the families of Israel who were with him, heard the words that the Reubenites and the Gadites and the Manassites spoke, they were satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest Phinehas son of Eleazar said to the Reubenites and the Gadites and the Manassites, “Today we know that the Lord is among us, because you have not committed this treachery against the Lord; now you have saved the Israelites from the hand of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest Phinehas son of Eleazar and the chiefs returned from the Reubenites and the Gadites in the land of Gilead to the land of Canaan, to the Israelites, and brought back word to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The report pleased the Israelites, and the Israelites blessed God and spoke no more of making war against them, to destroy the land where the Reubenites and the Gadites were settled.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Reubenites and the Gadites called the altar Witness, “for,” they said, “it is a witness between us that the Lord is God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A long time afterward, when the Lord had given rest to Israel from all their enemies all around and Joshua was old and well advanced in years,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua summoned all Israel, their elders and heads, their judges and officers, and said to them, “I am now old and well advanced in years,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you have seen all that the Lord your God has done to all these nations for your sake, for it is the Lord your God who has fought for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have allotted to you as an inheritance for your tribes those nations that remain, along with all the nations that I have already cut off, from the Jordan to the Great Sea in the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord your God will push them back before you and drive them out of your sight, and you shall possess their land, as the Lord your God promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore be very steadfast to observe and do all that is written in the book of the law of Moses, turning aside from it neither to the right nor to the left,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may not be mixed with these nations left here among you, or make mention of the names of their gods, or swear by them, or serve them, or bow yourselves down to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: but hold fast to the Lord your God, as you have done to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord has driven out before you great and strong nations, and as for you, no one has been able to withstand you to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of you puts to flight a thousand, since it is the Lord your God who fights for you, as he promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be very careful, therefore, to love the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you turn back and join the survivors of these nations left here among you and intermarry with them, so that you marry their women and they yours,
speaker: Narrator

text: know assuredly that the Lord your God will not continue to drive out these nations before you, but they shall be a snare and a trap for you, a scourge on your sides, and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land that the Lord your God has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And now I am about to go the way of all the earth, and you know in your hearts and souls, all of you, that not one thing has failed of all the good things that the Lord your God promised concerning you; all have come to pass for you; not one of them has failed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But just as all the good things that the Lord your God promised concerning you have been fulfilled for you, so the Lord will bring upon you all the bad things until he has destroyed you from this good land that the Lord your God has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you transgress the covenant of the Lord your God, which he enjoined on you, and go and serve other gods and bow down to them, then the anger of the Lord will be kindled against you, and you shall perish quickly from the good land that he has given to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem and summoned the elders, the heads, the judges, and the officers of Israel, and they presented themselves before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to all the people, “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Long ago your ancestors—Terah and his sons Abraham and Nahor—lived beyond the Euphrates and served other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I took your father Abraham from beyond the River and led him through all the land of Canaan and made his offspring many. I gave him Isaac,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Esau the hill country of Seir to possess, but Jacob and his children went down to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt with what I did in its midst, and afterward I brought you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I brought your ancestors out of Egypt, you came to the sea, and the Egyptians pursued your ancestors with chariots and horsemen to the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they cried out to the Lord, he put darkness between you and the Egyptians and made the sea come upon them and cover them, and your eyes saw what I did to Egypt. Afterward you lived in the wilderness a long time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I brought you to the land of the Amorites, who lived on the other side of the Jordan; they fought with you, and I handed them over to you, and you took possession of their land, and I destroyed them before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King Balak son of Zippor of Moab set out to fight against Israel. He sent and invited Balaam son of Beor to curse you,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I would not listen to Balaam; therefore he blessed you, so I rescued you out of his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you went over the Jordan and came to Jericho, the citizens of Jericho fought against you, as well as the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Girgashites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I handed them over to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent swarms of hornets ahead of you that drove out before you the two kings of the Amorites; it was not by your sword or by your bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: I gave you a land on which you had not labored and towns that you had not built, and you live in them; you eat the fruit of vineyards and oliveyards that you did not plant.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now, therefore, revere the Lord and serve him in sincerity and in faithfulness; put away the gods that your ancestors served beyond the River and in Egypt and serve the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if you are unwilling to serve the Lord, choose this day whom you will serve, whether the gods your ancestors served in the region beyond the River or the gods of the Amorites in whose land you are living, but as for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people answered, “Far be it from us that we should forsake the Lord to serve other gods,
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is the Lord our God who brought us and our ancestors up from the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery, and who did those great signs in our sight. He protected us along all the way that we went and among all the peoples through whom we passed,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Lord drove out before us all the peoples, the Amorites who lived in the land. Therefore we also will serve the Lord, for he is our God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joshua said to the people, “You cannot serve the Lord, for he is a holy God. He is a jealous God; he will not forgive your transgressions or your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you forsake the Lord and serve foreign gods, then he will turn and do you harm and consume you, after having done you good.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people said to Joshua, “No, we will serve the Lord!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen the Lord, to serve him.” And they said, “We are witnesses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Then put away the foreign gods that are among you, and incline your hearts to the Lord, the God of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people said to Joshua, “The Lord our God we will serve, and him we will obey.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day and made statutes and ordinances for them at Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God, and he took a large stone and set it up there under the oak in the sanctuary of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said to all the people, “See, this stone shall be a witness against us, for it has heard all the words of the Lord that he spoke to us; therefore it shall be a witness against you if you deal falsely with your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua sent the people away to their inheritances.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died, being one hundred ten years old.
speaker: Narrator

text: They buried him in his own inheritance at Timnath-serah, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel served the Lord all the days of Joshua and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua and had known all the work that the Lord did for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bones of Joseph, which the Israelites had brought up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem, in the portion of ground that Jacob had bought from the children of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for one hundred pieces of money; it became an inheritance of the descendants of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar son of Aaron died, and they buried him at Gibeah, the town of his son Phinehas, which had been given him in the hill country of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator
